Description: Four joining sherds (with 1924,1201.963 and 1031) of rim and wall of large North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl. Interior streakily glazed save for reserved band below rim; at mid-wall, between added red bands lined with white, frieze in white of alternating triple verticals and sets of three concentric circles lined with dots; below, remains of incised decoration (tongues?). Exterior slipped cream; from top: tongues between bands; black-figure animal frieze rampant lion to right, attacking boar (with rather equine head), with much added red; bands with added red bands lined in white framing stopt maeander frieze; frieze of goats to left (top of one remaining).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.168)
